newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Fatal E Coli found in beef in Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Fatal E Coli found in beef in Hong Kong.

text.p: Hong Kong's health authority said on Monday the fatal O-157 strain of E coli bacteria, which was found in beef in the territory in March, was detected again in a wholesale butchers this month.
The shop had formerly supplied meat to a supermarket where the first contaminated sample was found two months ago, the Department of Health said in a statement.
"This contaminated sample was taken by the Department of Health on May 6 as part of the follow-up work and preventive measures recommended since the detection of the last sample," a spokesman said.
The spokesman said all other samples taken recently from other meat shops in the territory were free of the bacteria.
The strain, blamed for the deaths of at least 11 people in Japan and 20 in Scotland earlier this year, was found in raw beef on sale at a Japanese-owned supermarket chain in Hong Kong in March.
